thread.title: Energy experts say winter 2015-16 will be less expensive
thread.title_full: Energy experts say winter 2015-16 will be less expensive - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Energy experts say winter 2015-16 will be less expensive
text:
CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - Energy officials say this winter shouldn't be as punishing on New Hampshire consumers as the harsh 2013-14 heating season.
At the New Hampshire Energy Summit on Monday, Robert Scott, a commissioner with the state Public Utilities Commission, said all energy providers have submitted rates that are from 8.6 percent to 40 percent cheaper than last year.
In the winter of 2013-14, Scott said state consumers spent about $5 billion more than a benchmark the state uses to compare seasons. This year, he expects that number will be about $1.3 billion.
Several factors affect consumer costs: Gas pipeline capacity, the cost and availability of other fuels, weather and demand.
New England pays more than other regions for electricity: Compared to New York state, it's 88 percent more expensive in New England.
